epicrisis: Hypotonia, seizures, walking and speech problems, cerebral atrophy, mitochondrial disease

hpo_input.name: Diffuse cerebral atrophy
hpo_input.definition: "Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Symptomatic seizures
hpo_input.definition: "A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed." [PMID:18184148]

hpo_input.name: Cerebral atrophy
hpo_input.definition: "Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Hypotonia
hpo_input.definition: "Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:21418198]

hpo_input.name: Speech articulation difficulties
hpo_input.definition: "Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds." []

hpo_input.name: Abnormal speech pattern
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormality in the sound (volume) or cadence (rate) of speech." []

epicrisis: Tremor and absence seizures, MRI showing asymmetric prominence of the left lateral ventricle and pes equinovarus

hpo_input.name: Tremor
hpo_input.definition: "An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:16344298, PMID:20589866]

hpo_input.name: Generalized non-motor (absence) seizure
hpo_input.definition: "A generalized non-motor (absence) seizure is a type of a type of dialeptic seizure that is of electrographically generalized onset. It is a generalized seizure characterized by an interruption of activities, a blank stare, and usually the person will be unresponsive when spoken to. Any ictal motor phenomena are minor in comparison to these non-motor features." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:28276060, PMID:28276062, PMID:28276064]

hpo_input.name: Lateral ventricular asymmetry
hpo_input.definition: "Abnormal difference in size between the left and right lateral cerebral ventricles." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6670-9157, PMID:18253688, PMID:2257506]

hpo_input.name: Typical absence seizure
hpo_input.definition: "A typical absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterized by its sudden onset, interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare, possibly a brief upward deviation of the eyes. Usually the patient will be unresponsive when spoken to. Duration is a few seconds to half a minute with very rapid recovery. Although not always available, an EEG would usually show 3 Hz generalized epileptiform discharges during the event." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:28276060, PMID:28276062, PMID:28276064, PMID:6790275]

epicrisis: Gait disturbance, suspected Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy

hpo_input.name: Gait disturbance
hpo_input.definition: "The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:27770207]

hpo_input.name: Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy
hpo_input.definition: "Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders)." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

epicrisis: Microcephaly, speech delay

hpo_input.name: Expressive language delay
hpo_input.definition: "A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Delayed speech and language development
hpo_input.definition: "A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Decreased head circumference
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormally reduced head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart. Microcephaly is defined as a head circumference (HC) that is great than two standard deviations below the mean of age- and gender-matched population based samples. Severe microcephaly is defined with an HC that is three standard deviations below the mean." [PMID:26505062]

hpo_input.name: Bronchitis
hpo_input.definition: "Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Congestive heart failure
hpo_input.definition: "The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Pulmonary edema
hpo_input.definition: "Fluid accumulation in the lungs." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Acute bronchitis
hpo_input.definition: "Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Oliguria
hpo_input.definition: "Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Renal insufficiency
hpo_input.definition: "A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome
hpo_input.definition: "A thrombotic microangiopathy with presence of non-immune, intravascular hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia and acute kidney injury. A vicious cycle of complement activation, endothelial cell damage, platelet activation, and thrombosis is the hallmark of the disease." [PMID:19846853, PMID:28416508]

hpo_input.name: Nephrotic syndrome
hpo_input.definition: "Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Anemia
hpo_input.definition: "A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Low number of red blood cells or haemoglobin

epicrisis: Epilepsy

hpo_input.name: Interictal epileptiform activity
hpo_input.definition: "Epileptiform activity refers to distinctive EEG waves or complexes distinguished from background activity found in in a proportion of human subjects with epilepsy, but which can also be found in subjects without seizures. Interictal epileptiform activity refers to such activity that occurs in the absence of a clinical or subclinical seizure." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Epileptic encephalopathy
hpo_input.definition: "A condition in which epileptiform abnormalities are believed to contribute to the progressive disturbance in cerebral function. Epileptic encephalaopathy is characterized by (1) electrographic EEG paroxysmal activity that is often aggressive, (2) seizures that are usually multiform and intractable, (3) cognitive, behavioral and neurological deficits that may be relentless, and (4) sometimes early death." [PMID:21590624, PMID:23213494]

epicrisis: Diagnosis of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, numbness and pain in hands, weakness and pain in right arm, neck pain, possibility of Fahr's syndrome

hpo_input.name: Neck pain
hpo_input.definition: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the neck." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0003-6754]

hpo_input.name: Upper limb muscle weakness
hpo_input.definition: "Weakness of the muscles of the arms." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Constrictive median neuropathy
hpo_input.definition: "Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hand pain
hpo_input.definition: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort localized to the hand." []

hpo_input.name: Hemiplegia/hemiparesis
hpo_input.definition: "Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Paralysis or weakness of one side of body

hpo_input.name: Upper limb pain
hpo_input.definition: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm." [https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5208-3432]

hpo_input.name: Hand paresthesia
hpo_input.definition: "Tingling (often referred to as a pins and needles feeling) and numbness in the hand." []

hpo_input.name: Positive Phalen test
hpo_input.definition: "The Phalen maneuver is performed by having the patient hold both wrists in complete and forced flexion (pushing the dorsal surfaces of both hands together) for 30-60 seconds. This can increase the pressure in the carpal tunnel. The test is positive (abnormal) if the patient experiences characteristic symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome (pain and paresthesias along the distribution of the median nerve, i.e., thumb, index finger, and middle finger)." [PMID:31773104]

epicrisis: Immune deficiency, recurrent abscesses in the body

hpo_input.name: Immunodeficiency
hpo_input.definition: "Failure of the immune system to protect the body adequately from infection, due to the absence or insufficiency of some component process or substance." [PMID:20042227]

hpo_input.name: Recurrent abscess formation
hpo_input.definition: "An increased susceptibility to abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent abscesses." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

epicrisis: Hypotonia, hypothermia, retrognathia, prominent nasal profile, muscular ventricular septal defect, and patent foramen ovale

hpo_input.name: Hypothermia
hpo_input.definition: "Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Retrognathia
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Prominent nose
hpo_input.definition: "Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip." [PMID:19152422]

hpo_input.name: Convex nasal ridge
hpo_input.definition: "Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low." [PMID:19152422]

hpo_input.name: Patent foramen ovale
hpo_input.definition: "Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hypotonia
hpo_input.definition: "Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:21418198]

synonym: Increased blood pressure in blood vessels of lungs

hpo_input.name: Pulmonary hemorrhage
hpo_input.definition: "Pulmonary hemorrhage is a bleeding within the lungs. Older children and adults may spit blood or bloody sputum. Neonates, infants and young children usually do not spit up blood. Anemia, pulmonary infiltrates, increasingling bloody return on BAL and the presence of hemosiderin-laden macrophages in broncho-alveolar lavage (BAL) fluid or lung biopsy can diagnose lung bleeding. Alveolar macrophages contain phagocytosed red blood cells and stain positive for hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, after about 48-72 hours following pulmonary hemorraghe. Previous or recurrent bleeding can thus be distinguished from fresh events. A differentiation into local or diffuse is of importance. Also differentiate if pulmonary hemorrhage is due to a primary lung disorder or a manifestation of a systemic disease." [PMID:16473816]

hpo_input.definition: "A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Low number of red blood cells or haemoglobin
Low number of red blood cells or hemoglobin

hpo_input.name: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
hpo_input.definition: "A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity" [PMID:19908070]

epicrisis: Hypotonia, metabolic acidosis, lactic acidosis, sudden cardiopulmonary arrest, and bilateral edema in the eyes

hpo_input.name: Lactic acidosis
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormal buildup of lactic acid in the body, leading to acidification of the blood and other bodily fluids." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Palpebral edema
hpo_input.definition: "Edema in the region of the eyelids." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hypotonia
hpo_input.definition: "Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:21418198]

hpo_input.name: Periorbital edema
hpo_input.definition: "Edema affecting the region situated around the orbit of the eye." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Metabolic acidosis
hpo_input.definition: "Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:17936961, PMID:31418093]

epicrisis: Epilepsy, articulation and gait disturbance, attention deficit, learning disability, cortical and cerebellar atrophy

hpo_input.name: Dysarthria
hpo_input.definition: "Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Cerebral cortical atrophy
hpo_input.definition: "Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Decrease in size of the outer layer of the brain due to loss of brain cells

hpo_input.name: Epileptic encephalopathy
hpo_input.definition: "A condition in which epileptiform abnormalities are believed to contribute to the progressive disturbance in cerebral function. Epileptic encephalaopathy is characterized by (1) electrographic EEG paroxysmal activity that is often aggressive, (2) seizures that are usually multiform and intractable, (3) cognitive, behavioral and neurological deficits that may be relentless, and (4) sometimes early death." [PMID:21590624, PMID:23213494]

hpo_input.name: Diminished ability to concentrate
hpo_input.definition: "The inability to focus or concentrate on a specific task, activity, or object. The subject may find themselves unable to grasp or understand written text and re-reads frequently without understanding. Familiar tasks or activities are severely compromised due to the lack of ability to concentrate. Thinking through multi-step problems is typically very difficult or impossible, leading to avoidance of such activities." [PMID:26386541]

hpo_input.name: Cerebellar atrophy
hpo_input.definition: "Cerebellar atrophy is defined as a cerebellum with initially normal structures, in a posterior fossa with normal size, which displays enlarged fissures (interfolial spaces) in comparison to the foliae secondary to loss of tissue. Cerebellar atrophy implies irreversible loss of tissue and result from an ongoing progressive disease until a final stage is reached or a single injury, e.g. an intoxication or infectious event." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:12169461, PMID:26331051]

hpo_input.name: Speech articulation difficulties
hpo_input.definition: "Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds." []

hpo_input.name: Gait disturbance
hpo_input.definition: "The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:27770207]

hpo_input.name: Specific learning disability
hpo_input.definition: "Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Short attention span
hpo_input.definition: "Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity." [PMID:26386541]

hpo_input.name: Ataxia
hpo_input.definition: "Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. hpo_input.name: Torticollis

hpo_input.name: Increased circulating lactate concentration

hpo_input.definition: "Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. hpo_input.definition: "The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. epicrisis: Male patient born in 2024. Hypotonia, narrow palate, retrognathia, VSD, hypertrichosis, undescended testes. Chromosome and microarray studies were normal. The first child is healthy. In the second pregnancy, a microdeletion was detected in the fetus and the pregnancy was terminated.

hpo_input.definition: "An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hypertrichosis
hpo_input.definition: "Hypertrichosis is increased hair growth that is abnormal in quantity or location." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Narrow palate
hpo_input.definition: "Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective)." [PMID:19125428]

hpo_input.name: Restrictive ventricular septal defect
hpo_input.definition: "Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:10798413]

hpo_input.name: Cryptorchidism
hpo_input.definition: "Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:23650202]

hpo_input.name: Hypotonia
hpo_input.definition: "Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:21418198]

hpo_input.name: Non-restrictive ventricular septal defect
hpo_input.definition: "Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that does not restrict flow across it sufficiently to generate a pressure gradient between the two sides of the VSD." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

epicrisis: Male patient, born 2024. Vomiting, hypoglycemia, bronchiolitis, neutropenia, recurrent fever, discharge from left ear, urinary tract infection

hpo_input.name: Vomiting

hpo_input.name: Recurrent fever
hpo_input.definition: "Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Recurrent urinary tract infections
hpo_input.definition: "Repeated infections of the urinary tract." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Neutropenia
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormally low number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:25642312]

hpo_input.name: Hypoglycemia
hpo_input.definition: "A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Bronchiolitis
hpo_input.definition: "Inflammation of the bronchioles." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers]

epicrisis: Male patient, born 2021, with speech delay, expressive gesturing, harming his older sister, dysmorphia, seizures (eye twitching, startling), sitting (+), walking (+)

hpo_input.name: Facial asymmetry
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Asymmetry of right and left side of face

hpo_input.name: Delayed speech and language development
hpo_input.definition: "A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Blepharospasm
hpo_input.definition: "A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Exaggerated startle response
hpo_input.definition: "An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Expressive language delay
hpo_input.definition: "A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Micrognathia
hpo_input.definition: "Developmental hypoplasia of the mandible." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Symptomatic seizures
hpo_input.definition: "A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed." [PMID:18184148]

hpo_input.name: Eyelid fasciculation
hpo_input.definition: "Tiny, repetitive muscle contractions in the eyelids, causing the appearance of twitching." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
hpo_input.definition: "Difficulty to establish relations with others in a comparable social group (peers) that may be manifested in pehnomena such as not being able to initiative a conversation, understand social cues, or to discuss shared interests. This feature is associated with poor integration within a community or group." []

epicrisis: Hypothyroidism, Goiter, Elevated TSH hormone, Pituitary microadenoma

hpo_input.name: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
hpo_input.definition: "Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0538-4547]

hpo_input.name: Pituitary adenoma
hpo_input.definition: "A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis (anterior pituitary)." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0538-4547, PMID:32119338]

hpo_input.name: Goiter
hpo_input.definition: "An enlargement of the thyroid gland." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Hypothyroidism
hpo_input.definition: "Deficiency of thyroid hormone." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

epicrisis: Male patient, born in 2011. First seizure at 9 months old. Second seizure at 18 months old—2 seizures in 2 days. Used Depakine for 4.5 years, then discontinued. Four years ago: incontinence, vacant staring, speech loss. Keppra started, discontinued after 2.5 years. Six months after discontinuation: vomiting, muscle stiffness, jaw locking. May 2024: vacant staring, unresponsiveness—3 episodes in one day. 10 days later: recurrent seizures, 3 in one day with absence and incontinence. One week ago: freezing-type seizure lasting 2–3 minutes with fever. Mother reports delayed comprehension. Epilepsy present in father's uncle and maternal grandfather's cousin's grandchild.

hpo_input.name: Urinary incontinence
hpo_input.definition: "Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154, PMID:12559262]

hpo_input.name: Infantile onset
hpo_input.definition: "Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Onset in first year of life

hpo_input.name: Vomiting
hpo_input.definition: "Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Language impairment
hpo_input.definition: "Language impairment is a deficit in comprehension or production of language that includes reduced vocabulary, limited sentence structure, or impairments in written or spoken communication. Language abilities are substantially and quantifiably below age expectations." []

hpo_input.name: Infantile spasms
hpo_input.definition: "Infantile spasms represent a subset of \"epileptic spasms\". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy)." [https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8486-0558]

hpo_input.name: Cutaneous anergy
hpo_input.definition: "Inability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
synonym: Absence of delayed hypersensitivity skin test
Lack of delayed skin hypersensitivity reaction

hpo_input.name: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
hpo_input.definition: "Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening." [https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5208-3432]

hpo_input.name: Severe expressive language delay
hpo_input.definition: "A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6410-0882]

hpo_input.name: Epilepsia partialis continua
hpo_input.definition: "Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years)." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1735-8178, PMID:26336950]

hpo_input.name: Muscle stiffness
hpo_input.definition: "A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Receptive language delay
hpo_input.definition: "A delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Fever
hpo_input.definition: "Body temperature elevated above the normal range." [https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154, PMID:9759682]

hpo_input.name: Early onset absence seizures
hpo_input.definition: "Typical absence seizures starting before the age of 4 years." [https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8486-0558]

hpo_input.name: Absent nipple
hpo_input.definition: "Congenital failure to develop, and absence of, the nipple." []

hpo_input.name: Absent smooth pursuit
hpo_input.definition: "A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Trismus
hpo_input.definition: "Limitation in the ability to open the mouth." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Complex febrile seizure
hpo_input.definition: "A febrile seizure that has any of the following features: focal semiology (or associated with post-ictal neurologic abnormalities beyond drowsiness, such as a Todd's paresis), prolonged seizure beyond 15 minutes, or recurring (occurring more than once) in a 24 hour period." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:19125841, PMID:972656]

hpo_input.name: Refractory drug response
hpo_input.definition: "Absent or significantly reduced efficacy of drug intervention characterized by lack of measurable benefit or deterioration of disease course." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7440-8864, PMID:29188449]

hpo_input.name: Focal behavior arrest seizure
hpo_input.definition: "A type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by an arrest or pause of activities, freezing, or immobilization as the predominant semiological feature throughout the seizure." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:28276060]

hpo_input.name: Impaired continence
hpo_input.definition: "Partial or total incontinence of bowel or bladder." []

epicrisis: Male patient, born 2022. Nephrotic syndrome, proteinuria, steroid-resistant, renal biopsy with no significant findings, suspected steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome. Family history of steroid-dependent nephrotic syndrome and breast cancer.

hpo_input.name: Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
hpo_input.definition: "A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2234-4248, PMID:29910038]

hpo_input.name: Nephrotic syndrome
hpo_input.definition: "Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Proteinuria
hpo_input.definition: "Increased levels of protein in the urine." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

epicrisis: Male patient, born in 2024. Craniosynostosis. Chronic respiratory failure. Syndromic appearance. Developmental delay (cannot sit, speak, make eye contact, swallow, or walk).

hpo_input.definition: "Delay or absence of the swallow response, reflexes triggered by the contact the food bolus makes with the anterior faucial pillars." [PMID:27785002]

hpo_input.name: obsolete Loss of ability to walk
Global developmental delay
hpo_input.definition: "A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6410-0882, https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

hpo_input.name: Abnormal nasal septum morphology
hpo_input.definition: "An abnormality of the nasal septum." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Reduced eye contact
hpo_input.definition: "A reduced frequency or duration of eye contact." []

hpo_input.name: Craniosynostosis
hpo_input.definition: "Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Pansynostosis
hpo_input.definition: "Craniosynostosis of all calvarial sutures." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2972-5481]

hpo_input.name: Respiratory failure
hpo_input.definition: "A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Mutism
hpo_input.definition: "Complete lack of speech or verbal communication in a person despite attempts to engage in conversation. Mutism as a phenomena assumes the individual has previous capacity for speech and in the pediatric population it assumes that the person is past the age of typical language development." [PMID:26709680]

hpo_input.name: Chronic respiratory acidosis
hpo_input.definition: "Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L)." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

hpo_input.name: Inability to walk
hpo_input.definition: "Incapability to ambulate." [https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
